title: The five-digit USGS parameter code is used to uniquely identify a specific constituent or property. Rice wells were sampled for Schedule 2033, whereas all other wells were sampled for Schedule 2032

Lifetime Health Advisory Level (USEPA); LRL, laboratory reporting level; MCL-CA, maximum contaminant level (CDPH); MCL-US, maximum contaminant level (USEPA); na, not available; RSD5-US, U.S. Environmental Protection Agency risk specific dose at a risk factor of 10–5 μg/L (RSD5s are calculated by dividing the 10–4 cancer risk concentration established by the USEPA by 10); USEPA, U.S
note: μg/L, micrograms per liter; —, analyzed but not detected
